p: In chickens fed lard or palm oil, the relative proportions of PUFAs were 15â€“16% of the total FAs, which was less than that in the respective diets (24 and 22%). Oleic acid dominated the lipids deposited in the bodies of all chickens. This dominance may be related to the fact that the oleic acid content in tissue lipids depends not only on the oleic acid intake but also on de novo synthesis.
